effects: You always have the spells in the Oath of Devotion Spells table prepared at the paladin levels shown.
You can imbue one weapon that you are holding with sacred power.
For 10 minutes, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls made with that weapon, and the weapon emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for 20 more feet.
You can end the effect early (no action required).
limits: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

effects: You and your allies are immune to the Charmed condition while in your Aura of Protection.
If a charmed ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there.
You and your allies have half cover while in your Aura of Protection until the start of your next turn.
You imbue your Aura of Protection with holy power for 10 minutes (or until you end it).
Holy Ward: you have advantage on saving throws forced by fiends or undead.
Radiant Damage: when an enemy starts its turn in the aura, it takes radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier + your Proficiency Bonus.
Sunlight: the aura is filled with bright light that is sunlight.
limits: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
You can restore your use of this feature by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).
